meanings.definition: A person who engages in conversation or discussion.
meanings.sent1: The group of discoursers shared their thoughts on the book.
meanings.sent2: The discoursers at the meeting had different opinions on the topic.
meanings.sent3: The discoursers at the party debated whether cats or dogs make better pets.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, the discoursers are always trying to persuade others to their point of view.
meanings.sent5: The discoursers in the classroom were eager to participate in the debate.

meanings.definition: The act of speaking or writing about a particular topic.
meanings.sent1: Her discoursers on climate change were well-researched and informative.
meanings.sent2: The professor's discoursers on Shakespeare captivated the students.
meanings.sent3: During the lecture, his discoursers on aliens visiting Earth drew some chuckles from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The poet's discoursers on love painted a vivid picture of heartbreak and longing.
meanings.sent5: The politician's discoursers on education reform sparked a lively debate among the audience.
